titleStmt.title: A dialogue philosophicall. Wherein natures secret closet is opened, and the cause of all motion in nature shewed ovt of matter and forme, tending to mount mans minde from nature to supernaturall and celestial promotion: and how all things exist in the number of three. : Together with the wittie inuention of an artificiall perpetuall motion, presented to the kings most excellent maiestie. / All which are discoursed betweene two speakers, Philadelph, and Theophrast, brought together by Thomas Tymme, professour of diuinitie..
titleStmt.author: Tymme, Thomas, d. 1620.

titleStmt.title: A dialogue philosophicall. Wherein natures secret closet is opened, and the cause of all motion in nature shewed ovt of matter and forme, tending to mount mans minde from nature to supernaturall and celestial promotion: and how all things exist in the number of three. : Together with the wittie inuention of an artificiall perpetuall motion, presented to the kings most excellent maiestie. / All which are discoursed betweene two speakers, Philadelph, and Theophrast, brought together by Thomas Tymme, professour of diuinitie..
titleStmt.author: Tymme, Thomas, d. 1620.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T.S. for Clement Knight, and are to be s[oul]d at his Shop in Paules Church-yard, at the signe the Holy Lambe.,

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: torn, stained, with loss of text.
Reproduction of original in: Folger Shakespeare Library.
